page.title: 13FARMING AROUND CHARLBURY
page.content: There are 8 biggish farms around Charlbury. Most of them are arable. Walcot Farm is situated on the Oxfordshire Way,next to the Cotswold Railway Line.It has livestock as well. Shorthampton Farm is beside the old church in Shorthampton. In Spelsbury we find Glebe Farm next to the church, and Grove Farm. Both these farms are arable but also have sheep,cows and the usual hens. Over the years,what was traditionally sheep country has been turned over to arable farming or intensively managed grassland. This area, particularly around the villages of Spelsbury and Chadlington is criss-crossed by public footpaths. The nearby Cornbury Estate owns lots of the land,and the small woods, which are remnants of Wychwood Forest.These are left as cover for game birds.
